Generation IV.Diamond: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
Generation IV.Pearl: The way its two tail fins flutter while it swims has earned it the nickname " Beautifly of the Sea."
Generation IV.Platinum: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins, it looks like a Beautifly . At night, the patterns on its tail fins softly shine.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins, it looks like a Beautifly . At night, the patterns on its tail fins softly shine.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

Generation VII.Sun: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
Generation VII.Moon: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They're popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The way its two tail fins flutter while it swims has earned it the nickname Beautifly of the Sea.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: "finery fish."

Generation IX.Scarlet: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
Generation IX.Violet: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
